Class Player

java.lang.Object
MyGame.Services.PublisherService<TicTacToe.Status>
MyGame.Client.Client
MyGame.Client.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Publisher<TicTacToe.Status>, Service
public final class Player extends Client
A human-controlled client.

Implements decideMove() that prompts the player to pick their move, overrides createGame(java.lang.String) so that it returns a TicTacToeUI, and allows the user to cancel the join request.

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player()
      Creates a human-controlled client.

      Overrides the parent's constructor to create a service that allows the user to cancel a join request.

      See Also:
      • Client()

  • Method Details

    • createGame

      TicTacToe createGame(String opponentID)
      Overrides Client.createGame(java.lang.String) to return a TicTacToeUI instead of a TicTacToe, the former being capable of printing the board to the screen and prompting the user to choose a move.

      Also cancels the service that lets user cancel a join request, because when this method is called, the game has already started.

      Overrides:
      createGame in class Client
      Parameters:
      opponentID - the opponent's ID
      Returns:
      a new TicTacToe instance
      See Also:
      • Client.createGame(java.lang.String)

    • decideMove

      int decideMove()
      Prompts the user to choose the move.
      Specified by:
      decideMove in class Client
      Returns:
      the move to be played
      See Also:
      • TicTacToeUI.prompt()

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Description copied from class: Client
      Stops all game-related services.

      This is called when the game is over. If force-called, if the client is not yet in a game, it will drop the join request; if it's in a game, it will abandon the game.

      Specified by:
      stop in interface Service
      Overrides:
      stop in class Client
